subject: Re: [junit] what isTestSuite?
msgSnippet: People could learn so much, if they would just use www.google.com.  TestSuite has almost 2 million references.  The first one is a good start. Bill ... hello
messageBody:
People could learn so much, if they would just use www.google.com. TestSuite has almost 2 million references. The first one is a good start.
Bill

-------------- Original message --------------
hello all,
just tell me, what is the TestSuite?

java developer

Chris Dollin <kers@...> wrote:
On Thursday 15 September 2005 21:28, Nathaniel Troutman wrote:

> I have abstracted out the creation of lists to a utility class, so
> that my TestCases call methods of the Utility class for a new list,
> this way I only have to change the constructors in one class, when I
> want to use my other implementations of the list. I would like to be
> able to pass my test cases the object to use for creating lists so
> that I can have a different untility class for each impelmentation. So
> I need to be able to pass a untility object to each test case before
> it runs any of the tests. So far I haven't found a way to do this JUnit.

Standard trick: make your test case class abstract, with an
abstract method delivering the create-a-list object.

Subclass three times, once for each implementation, defining
that abstract method to return this implementation's create-a-list
object.

Now create a suite from those three subclasses.

Voila.

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
Logic is rational /re/construction. Life is construction.
